Class LogoutScreen

java.lang.Object
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.Screen
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.option.OptionScreen
com.group6.hms.app.managers.auth.LogoutScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScreenLifeCycle
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdministratorScreen, DoctorScreen, PatientScreen, PharmacistScreen
public abstract class LogoutScreen extends OptionScreen
The LogoutScreen class provides a screen for users to log out. It extends OptionScreen to provide a logout option and uses LoginManager to handle the logout process. The class is abstract. Subclasses must implement the onLogout() method to define actions upon logout.

  • Constructor Details

    • LogoutScreen

      protected LogoutScreen(String title)
      Constructor to initialize the LogoutScreen with a header. This constructor passes the header to the parent Screen class.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the screen, which is displayed as a header.

      public void onStart()
      Called when the screen starts. It initializes any additional setup and calls the parent class's onStart method.
      Specified by:

      Overrides:

    • handleOptionOnBack

      protected void handleOptionOnBack(int optionId)
      Handles options when the user navigates back from the screen. If the logout option is selected, it triggers the logout() method.
      Overrides:
      handleOptionOnBack in class OptionScreen
      Parameters:
      optionId - The ID of the option selected by the user.

    • onLogout

      protected abstract void onLogout()
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to define specific actions upon logout.
